"I'm not sure if I'll ever learn to cook. It seems like every time I step into the kitchen, I end up burning myself. Maybe it's just not meant to be."

Explanation:

In this post, the individual attributes their lack of cooking ability to their own personal failures (internal attributional style). To transfer this post to an external attributional style, we can attribute the cause to something external, such as the difficulty of the task or the environment. For example:

Transferred Post: "I'm not sure if I'll ever learn to cook. It's a challenging skill to master, and the hot kitchen environment can be unforgiving. Maybe it's just not meant to be."

In this transferred post, we have changed the attribution from an internal factor (the individual's personal failures) to an external factor (the difficulty of the task and the hot kitchen environment). This shift in attribution style allows us to maintain the event part of the post while transforming the attribution style.
